title: How many Indians know about K-pop? - Quora

response.answer_text: A lot of people in Northeast Indian states such as Assam, Manipur, Nagaland and Mizoram are aware of K-pop. In regards to mainland India I’m not sure but the number is growing. In general, Korean pop culture in the form of Korean dramas, K-fashion and K-pop have long enjoyed popularity in the Northeast since the early 2000s. The K-pop Contest in India is very popular and attracts many people of Northeast Indian origin and a growing number of mainland Indians as well. “Northeast Is The Heart of The Korean Wave in India” an article about the K-pop Contest in India. Pictured below are Northeast Indians who sing or dance to K-pop songs and have notable followings on social media.  Priyanka Mazumdar who is of Assamese descent releases covers of K-pop songs and has competed in many K-pop contests including the K-pop World Festival where she won the “Best Vocal Award” in 2016.  Edwin Jamir who is from Nagaland won K-pop Contest in 2013.  Dance Xenos are a dance group from Assam that dance to K-pop songs. They competed in the 2015 edition of K-pop Contest. In India, K-pop is gaining popularity outside of Northeast India. For example, according to this forum, BLACKPINK’s latest single, “As If It’s Your Last” reached a peak of #10 on the iTunes Top 100 Indian singles charts. It’s fair to say that it wasn’t just Northeast Indian fans who helped the song attain that position. As a result, it shows that K-pop is gaining traction in other parts of India as well.

Well before 2 years it was quite popular in just north eastern parts of India,but it was Gangnam Style, the wild blockbuster by singer Psy, that put this form not only in India but on the world map. Today it has become almost a cult with fan followers and practitioners across the world. It is to locate this talent in India that the Korean Cultural Centre started hosting its K-Pop festival a couple of years ago. The centre invites young musicians and dancers from across the country to present their take on K-Pop and after nearly two months of audition a winner is picked. The gangnam style and K-pop festival has made k-pop quite popular in the entire Indian nation. Majority of the dancers,musicians and all those related  knows about k-pop now and they are very much enthusiastic to be a part of the same.
